hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Five are Fawasiq which may be killed in the Haram: the mouse, the scorpion, the crow, the kite, and the barbed dog."
question: How does Islamic law address the issue of harmful animals in sacred areas?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The Muhrim may kill the wild beast of prey, the rabid dog, the mouse, the scorpion, the kite, and the crow."
question: How does Islamic law address the issue of safety and protection for a Muhrim in relation to dangerous animals?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah was cupped while he was a Muhrim."
question: What are the implications of performing medical treatments during the state of Ihram?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Ma'mar wanted to have his son married. S he sent me to Aban bin Uthman who was the Amir of the (Hajj) season. I went to him and said: 'Your brother wants to marry his son and he would like for you to witness that.' He said: 'I think he is but a crude Bedouin; indeed the Muhrim is not to marry nor have someone married'" - or he said similarly - then he narrated from Uthman similar in Marfu form (from the Prophet).
question: What role do cultural perceptions, such as being a Bedouin, play in Islamic legal decisions?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah married Maimunah while he was Halal, and he stayed with her while he was Halal, and I was the messenger between the two of them."
question: How does the concept of being a messenger or intermediary appear in Islamic historical narratives?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet married Maimunah while he was a Muhrim."
question: How does the state of Ihram affect the permissibility of certain actions in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet married Maimunah while he was a Muhrim."
question: What are the implications of the Prophet's actions for Muslims performing Hajj or Umrah?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet married Maimunah while he was a Muhrim."
question: What are the implications of the Prophet's actions for Muslims who are in a state of Ihram?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah married he while he was Halal and he stayed with her while he was Halal. She died in Sarif, and we buried her at the (site of the) tent where he had stayed wit her."
question: What can be learned about the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) marriages from historical narrations?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The land game is lawful for you while you are in Ihram as long as you did not hunt it - or - it was not hunted for you."
question: What are the implications of someone else hunting on behalf of a person in Ihram?

hadith-eng: He was with the Prophet and when he got to one of the roads of Makkah some of the companions were Muhrim and he (Abu Qatadah) was not a Muhrim. So he saw a wild donkey, so he mounted his horse, asked his companions to give him his whip but they refused, so he asked them to give him his spear and they refused. So he (himself) took it and struck the donkey killing it. Some of the Companions of the Prophet ate it and some of them refused. When they caught up to the Prophet they asked him about that and he said: "It is only food which Allah fed you."
question: How does the Prophet's response guide the companions regarding the consumption of hunted animals?

hadith-eng: About the wild donkey, and it is similar to the (previous) narrated of Abu An-Nadr except that in the narration of Zaid bin Aslam he said that the Messenger of Allah said: "Do you have any of its meat left with you?"
question: What does the Prophet's question reveal about the practices related to hunting and consumption in Islam?

hadith-eng: As-S'ab bin Jath-thamah informed him that the Messenger of Allah had passed him at Al-Abwa or Bawaddan. He (As-S'ab) gave him a wild donkey but he refused it. When the Messenger of Allah noticed on his face that he was upset, he said: "We would not refuse you, but we are in Ihram"
question: How does the state of Ihram affect the acceptance of gifts or offerings?

hadith-eng: "We went with the Messenger of Allah during Hajj or Umrah and we encountered a swarm of locusts. We began striking at them with our whips and set our staffs, and the Prophet said: "Eat it, for indeed it is game of the sea."
question: What actions did the companions take when they encountered a swarm of locusts during Hajj or Umrah?

hadith-eng: "I asked Jabir bin Abdullah: 'Is the hyena game?' He said: 'Yes'" He said: "I said: 'Can it be eaten?' He said: 'Yes.'" He said: "I said: 'Did the Messenger of Allah say that?' He said: 'Yes.'"
question: What role do companions play in conveying the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Ghusl for entered Makkah at Fakhkh."
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's practices regarding cleanliness and preparation for entering sacred places?

hadith-eng: "When Prophet came to Makkah he entered it from its higher side, and left from its lower side."
question: Why might the Prophet's method of entering and exiting Makkah be noteworthy?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet entered Makkah during the daytime."
question: How does the Prophet's entry into Makkah during the daytime relate to Islamic teachings on transparency and openness?

hadith-eng: Jabir bin Abdulla was asked about a man raising his hands when he sees the House (Ka'bah). So he said: 'We performed Hajj with the Messenger of Allah and we did it."
question: What practices did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and his companions follow during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "When the Prophet arrived in Makkah, he entered the Masjid and touched the (Black) Stone, then went to his right and performed Raml (walking quickly) for three (circuits) and walking for four. Then he came to the Maqam and said: 'And take you (people) the Maqam (place) of Ibrahim as a place of prayer.' Then he performed two Rak'ah while the Maqam was between him and the House. Then he came to the (Black) Stone after the two Rak'ah to touch it, then he left to As-Safa - I think - he said: Indeed As-Safa and Al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah."
question: What is the importance of the Maqam of Ibrahim in Islamic rituals?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Raml from the (Black) Stone to the (Black) Stone for three (circuits), and he walked four (circuits)."
question: What is the starting and ending point for performing Raml during Tawaf?

hadith-eng: "I was with Ibn Abbas, and Mu'awiyah would not pass any corner without touching it. So Ibn Abbas said to him: 'the Prophet would not touch any besides the Black Stone and the Yemeni corner.' So Mu'awiyah said: 'There is no part of the House that is untouchable.'"
question: What can be inferred about the practices of Tawaf from the interaction between Ibn Abbas and Mu'awiyah?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Tawaf of the House Mudtabi'an, and he was wearing a Burd."
question: How does the Prophet's practice during Tawaf serve as a guide for Muslims?

hadith-eng: "I saw Umar bin Al-Khattab kissing the (Black) Stone and saying: 'I am kissing you while I know that you are just a stone, and if I had not seen the Messenger of Allah kissing you, I would not kiss you.'"
question: What role does the Black Stone play in Islamic rituals and beliefs?

hadith-eng: That a man asked Ibn Umar about touching the (Black) Stone, so he said: "I saw the Prophet touching it and kissing it." So the man said: "What is your view if there is a throng (around the Ka'bah) and what is your view if the people overpowered me?" Ibn Umar said: "Leave 'What is your view' in Yemen. I saw the Prophet touching it and kissing it."
question: Why might someone ask about the permissibility of touching the Black Stone?

hadith-eng: "When the Prophet arrived in Makkah, he performed seven (circuits) of Tawaf around the House. Then he came to the Maqam and said:  And take you (people) the Maqam (place) of Ibrahim as a place of prayer. Then he prayed behind the Maqam. Then he came to the (Black) Stone to touch it. Then he said: 'We begin with what Allah began with.' So he began at As-Safa and recited: Indeed As-Safa and Al-Marwah are among the Symbols of Allah."
question: What is the significance of starting at As-Safa during the pilgrimage rituals?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah only performed the Sa'i of the House and of As-Safa and Al-Marwah to show his strength to the idolaters."
question: How did the actions of the Prophet serve as a message to the idolaters?

hadith-eng: "I saw Ibn Umar walking at the place of Sa'i so I said to him: 'Do you walk at the place of Sa'i between As-Safa and Al-Marwah?' He said: 'If I performed Sa'i, then it is because I saw the Messenger of Allah performing Sa'i there, and if I walked, then it is because I have seen the Messenger of Allah walking. And I am an old man.'"
question: Why might a companion of the Prophet choose to walk during Sa'i instead of running?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Tawaf upon his mount, so when he arrived at the (Black Stone) corner, he pointed to it."
question: What are the different ways to acknowledge the Black Stone during Tawaf?

hadith-eng: "Whoever performed Tawaf around the House fifty time, he will be as free of his sins as the day his mother bore him."
question: How is the state of a person described after completing fifty Tawaf according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "We considered Abdullah bin Sa'eed bin Jubair to be better than his father, and he had a brother named Abdul-Malik bin Sa'eed bin Jubair who also reported from him."
question: How were comparisons made between different narrators in terms of their reliability and knowledge?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "O Banu Abd Manaf! Do not prevent anyone from performing Tawaf around this House, and Salat, whichever hour it is of the night or day."
question: How does this guidance emphasize the accessibility of religious practices in Islam?

hadith-eng: During the two Rak'ah of Tawaf, the Messenger of Allah recited the two Surat of Ikhlas, "Say: O you disbelievers!" and: "Say: He is Allah, (the) One."
question: What are the benefits of reciting specific Surahs during the Tawaf prayer?

hadith-eng: that he considered it recommended for the two Rak'ah of Tawaf to recite: Say: "O you disbelievers!" and: Say: "He is Allah, (the) One."
question: What are the benefits of performing the two Rak'ah of Tawaf with specific Surahs?

hadith-eng: XI asked Ali: "What is it that you were sent with?" He said: "With four things: None will be admitted into Paradise except for the soul that is a Muslim. None is to perform Tawaf around the House while naked. The Muslims and the idolaters will not be gathering (in Makkah) together after this year. And for whomever there is a covenant between him and the Prophet, then his covenant is (valid) until its term, and for that in which there was no term, then it shall be four months."
question: How are covenants between individuals and the Prophet treated in terms of their validity and duration?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet left me while he had a joyous look of contentment and he returned to me grieving. So I asked him about that and he said: 'I entered the Ka'bah, and I wished that I had not done it. I fear that my Ummah will follow me (in that) after me.'"
question: How did Aishah respond to the Prophet's change in demeanor?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Salat in the interior of the Ka'bah." And Ibn Abbas said: "He did not perform Salat in it, but he said the Takbir."
question: What is the importance of Takbir in Islamic rituals and practices?

hadith-eng: Ibn Az-Zubair said to him: "Narrated to me from what the Mother of the Believers used to (secretly) inform you about" - meaning Aishah - so he said: "She narrated to me that the Messenger of Allah said: 'Had your people not been still close to the pre-Islamic period of ignorance, then I would demolish the Ka'bah and rebuild it with two doors.'" He said: "So when Ibn Az-Zubair came to power he demolished it and rebuilt it with two doors."
question: How did Ibn Az-Zubair's actions reflect the Prophet's intentions regarding the Ka'bah?

hadith-eng: "I wanted to enter the House to perform Salat in it, so the Messenger of Allah took me by the hand and put me in the Hijr, and he said: 'Perform Salat in the Hijri if you want to enter the House. For indeed it is part of the House, but your people considered it insignificant when they built the Ka'bah, so they put it outside the House.'"
question: How does the Hijr relate to the original structure of the Ka'bah?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The Black Stone descended from the Paradise, and it was more white than milk, then it was blackened by the sins of the children of Adam."
question: What does the original color of the Black Stone signify in Islamic belief?

hadith-eng: He heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "Indeed the Corner and the Maqam are two corundums from the corundum of Paradise. Allah removed their lights, and if their lights had not been removed then they would illuminate what is between east and the west."
question: What does the removal of the lights from the Corner and the Maqam signify?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah led us in Salat at Mina for Zuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha, and Fajr, then he left in the morning to Arafat."
question: How does the Prophet's practice of leading prayers at specific locations during Hajj guide Muslims today?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet prayed Zuhr and Fajr in Mina, then he left in the morning to Arafat.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's travel from Mina to Arafat during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "We said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Shall we build a structure to shade you at Mina? He said: 'No., Mina is a resting place for whoever arrives.'"
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) approach to comfort and simplicity from his response at Mina?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Mirba Al-Ansari came to us while we were standing at our places" (Amr bin Sinar said:) a place that Amr (bin Abdullah) indicated was far - "and he said: 'I am a messenger whom the Messenger of Allah sent to you to say: 'Stay with your (Hajj) rites, for indeed you are following a legacy left by Ibrahim.'"
question: How does the concept of legacy influence religious practices in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Quraish and those who followed their religion - and they were called Al-Hums - would stand at Al-Muzdalifah, and they would say: 'We are the people of Allah.' The others would stand at Arafat, so Allah the Mighty and Sublime revealed: Then depart from where the people depart."
question: What divine instruction was revealed regarding the departure during the pilgrimage?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah stopped at Arafat and said: 'This is Arafah and it is a place of standing. And all of Arafat is a place for standing.' Then he departed when the sun had set and took Usamah bin Zaid as a companion rider, and he was motioning with his hand as was his custom, and the people were striking (their camels) on the right and the left to try and catch them, so he said: 'O you people! Be calmm.' Then he came to Jama and performed the two Salat there combined. When the morning came, he went to Quzah and stood there and said: 'This is Quzah, and it is a place of standing, and all of Jama is a place for standing.' Then he departed until he arrived at Wadi Muhassir. Then he stuck his she-camel and she trotted until he passed the valley. Then he stopped and took Al-Fadl as a companion rider and went to the Jamrah to stone it. Then he went to Al-Manhar and said: 'This is Al-Manhar, and all of Mina is a place for sacrifice.' A young girl from Khath'am came to ask him for a verdict, she said: 'Indeed my father is an elderly man who has lived until Allah has made Hajj obligatory, so would he be rewarded if I perform Hajj for him? He said: 'Perform Hajj for your father.'" He said: "And he turned the neck of Al Fadl. So Al-Abbas said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Why did you turn the neck of your cousin?' He said: 'I saw a young man and a young woman, and they were not safe from Shaitan.' A man came to him and said, 'O Messenger of Allah! I performed (Tawaf) Al-Ifadah before shaving.' He said: 'Shave, and there is no harm'" - or: 'Clip and there is no harm'" He said: "Someone else came and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I did the sacrifice before stoning.' So he said: 'Stone, and there is no harm.'" He said: "Then he went to the House (Ka'bah) to perform Tawaf around it, then he went to Zamzam and said: 'O tribe of Abdul-Muttalib! If it were not that the people would rush upon you then I would remove it.'"
question: What actions did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) take during the Hajj rituals, and what do they signify?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet hurried through Wadi Muhassir." Bishr (one of the narrators) added: "He departed from Jam calmly and he ordered them (the people) to be calm." And Abu Nu'aim (one of the narrators) added: "And he ordered them to do the stoning with what was similar to pebbles for Al-Khadhf' And he said: "Perhaps I will not see you after this year."
question: What can be inferred from the Prophet's statement about possibly not seeing the people after that year?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Umar prayed at Jam (Muzdalifah), so he combined two prayers with the Iqamah, and he said: 'I saw the Messenger of Allah doing the same as this at the place.'"
question: Why is it important to follow the practices of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) during Hajj rituals?

hadith-eng: Similarly from Ibn Umar, from the Prophet.
question: What is the significance of Jami` at-Tirmidhi in the collection of hadiths?

hadith-eng: Some people among the residents of Najd came to the Messenger of Allah while he was at Arafat. They were questioning him, so he ordered a caller to proclaim: "The Hajj is Arafah. Whoever came to Jam during the night, before the time of Fajr, then he has attended the Hajj. The days of Mina are three, so whoever hastens (leaving after) two days, then there is no sin upon him, and whoever delays, then there is no sin upon him." Muhammad said: "Yahya added: 'And he took a companion rider to proclaim it.'"
question: How does the proclamation of Hajj rituals help in guiding pilgrims?

hadith-eng: (Another chain) with a similar narration (as no. 889).
question: Why is it important to reference the book and hadith number when citing a hadith?

hadith-eng: "I came to the Messenger of Allah at Al-Muzdalifah when he left for the Salat. I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I came from the two mountains of (the tribe of) Tai, wearing out my mount and exhausting myself. By Allah! I did not leave a Habl (sand dune) without stopping on it. So is there Hajj for me?' The Messenger of Allah said: 'Whoever attends this Salat of ours, and stays here with us until departing, while he has stood during the night or the day before that at Arafat, then he has completed his Hajj and fulfilled his Tafath.'"
question: How does the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) address the concerns of a pilgrim who has traveled a long distance for Hajj?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah sent me with the Thaqal (load of baggage) during the night from Jam."
question: What is the importance of carrying or managing baggage during a journey in Islamic context?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet advanced the weak among his family and he said: 'Do not stone the Jamrah until the sun has risen.'"
question: What are the implications of timing in the performance of religious duties?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would stone on the Day of An-Nahr during the morning light, as for (the days) afterwards, then (he would do it) after the Zenith of the sun."
question: What is the importance of performing rituals at specific times during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "We were halted at Jama when Umar bin Al-Khattab said: 'The idolaters would not depart until the sun had risen and they would say: "Let the sun shine on Thabir" and indeed the Messenger of Allah contradicted them.' So Umar departed before the rising of the sun."
question: What role did Umar bin Al-Khattab play in following the Prophet's guidance at Jama?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Messenger of Allah stoning the Jimar with what was similar to pebbles for Al-Khadhaf."
question: What is the historical context of the stoning ritual in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah stoned the Jimar when the sun had passed the zenith."
question: How does the practice of stoning the Jimar relate to the overall pilgrimage experience?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet stoned the Jamrah on the Day of An-Nahr while riding."
question: How does the practice of stoning the Jamrah relate to the overall Hajj experience?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would walk when stoning the Jimar, both going and returning."
question: What are the practices associated with the stoning of the Jimar during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "When Abdullah went to stone Jamrat Al-Aqabah, he went to the middle of the valley, faced the Ka'bah, and proceeded to stone the Jamrah at its southern wall. Then he stoned with seven pebbles, saying: "Allahu Akbar" with each pebble. Then he said: 'By Allah except Whom none is worthy of worship. This is where the one stoned to whom Surat Al-Baqarah was revealed.'"
question: Why is the phrase 'Allahu Akbar' recited during the stoning ritual in Hajj?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Stoning the Jimari and Sa'i between As-Safa and Al-Marwah are only done for the establishment of Allah's remembrance."
question: What is the purpose of performing Sa'i during the pilgrimage?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Prophet stoning the Jimar upon his she-camel; there was no hitting, nor crowding, nor: 'Look out! Look out!'"
question: How does the Prophet's conduct during the stoning of the Jimar reflect on his leadership qualities?

hadith-eng: "We slaughtered with the Messenger of Allah during the year of Al-Hudaibiyah: a cow for seven, and a Badanah for seven."
question: What historical event is associated with the year of Al-Hudaibiyah in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "We were with the Prophet on a journey (on the Day of) Adha, so seven of us shared in a cow, and ten for a camel."
question: What does this narration teach about communal participation in religious rituals?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet garlanded two sandals and marked the Hadi on the right side at Dhul-Hulaifah, and removed the blood from it."
question: What are the practices associated with the Hadi at Dhul-Hulaifah?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet purchased his Hadi in Qudaid."
question: What are the implications of the Prophet's actions on the understanding of religious rituals?

hadith-eng: "I twisted the garlands for the Hadi of the Prophet, then he did not assume Ihram, nor did he avoid any clothing."
question: What does this narration suggest about the Prophet's practice regarding clothing during the preparation of the Hadi?

hadith-eng: "I twisted the garlands for all of the Hadi of the Messenger of Allah, which were sheep, then he did not assume Ihram."
question: What role did Aishah play in the preparation of the Messenger of Allah's sacrificial animals?

hadith-eng: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! What should be done with the afflicted among the Hadi?' He said: 'Slaughter them, then dip their sandals in their blood, then leave them so that the people can eat them.'"
question: What is the role of community participation in the consumption of slaughtered animals in Islam?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet saw a man driving his Badanah so he said to him: "Ride it." He said: "O Messenger of Allah! It is a Badanah." So on the third or fourth time he said to him: "Ride it. And woe to you!"
question: How does this narration illustrate the balance between religious rituals and practical needs?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah stoned the Jamrah, he slaughtered his sacrifice, then he presented the barber the right side (of his head) and he shaved it, then he gave (the hair) to Abu Talhah. Then he presented the left side to him and he shaved it. Then he said: 'Divide it (the hair) among the people.'"
question: What role did Abu Talhah play in the distribution of the Prophet's hair?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "May Allah have mercy upon those who shaved" saying it one or two times, then he said: "And those who shortened."
question: Why might there be a distinction between those who shave and those who shorten in this context?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah prohibited that a woman should shave her head."
question: What are the cultural or religious reasons behind prohibiting women from shaving their heads in Islam?

hadith-eng: "A man asked the Messenger of Allah: 'I shaved before slaughtering.' So he said: 'Slaughter, and there is no harm.' Another man asked him: 'I performed the sacrifice before stoning.' He said: 'Stone, and there is no harm.'"
question: How does this narration illustrate the Prophet's approach to addressing concerns of the companions?

hadith-eng: "I put perfume with musk in it on the Messenger of Allah before he assumed Ihram, and on the Day of An-Nahr before he performed Tawaf around the House."
question: What role does personal hygiene play in the rituals of Hajj and Umrah?

hadith-eng: "I was a companion rider with the Messenger of Allah from Jam to Mina. He did not cease saying the Talbiyah until stoning Jamrat Al-Aqabah."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) perform the Talbiyah during his journey from Jam to Mina?

hadith-eng: (that the Prophet): "Would stop saying the Talbiyah during "Umrah when he touched the (Black) Stone."
question: How does the act of touching the Black Stone relate to the completion of the Talbiyah?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet delayed the visiting Tawaf until the night."
question: What are the reasons for performing Tawaf at night?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet, Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman would camp at Al-Abtah."
question: What can be learned from the actions of the Prophet and his companions regarding their choice of camping sites?

hadith-eng: "At-Tahsib is nothing, it is only a place that the Messenger of Allah camped at."
question: What does the hadith imply about the practices or rituals associated with At-Tahsib?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah only camped at Al-Abtah because it was easier for his departure."
question: What significance does the location of Al-Abtah hold in Islamic history?

hadith-eng: "A woman held a boy of hers up for the Messenger of Allah and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Is there Hajj for this one' He said: 'Yes, and you will be rewarded.'"
question: How does the participation of children in Hajj affect their spiritual upbringing?

hadith-eng: "My father took me for Hajj with the Messenger of Allah during the Farewell Hajj, and I was seven years old."
question: What are the responsibilities of a parent when taking a child for Hajj?

hadith-eng: "When we performed our Hajj with the Prophet we would say the Talbiyah for the women and we would stone for the boys."
question: What is the role of stoning in the rituals of Hajj?

hadith-eng: "A woman from Khath'am said: 'O Messenger of Allah! My father has lived until Allah has made Hajj obligatory, and he is an elderly man who is not able to sit on the back of a camel.' So he (pbuh) said: 'Perform Hajj for him.'"
question: What is the significance of Hajj in Islam, and how does it relate to family responsibilities?

hadith-eng: "A woman came to the Prophet and said: 'My mother died and she did not perform Hajj should I perform Hajj on her behalf?' He said: 'Yes, perform Hajj on her behalf.'"
question: How does Islam view fulfilling the religious duties of those who have passed away?

hadith-eng: That he went to the Prophet and said: "O Messenger of Allah! My father is an elderly man who is not able to perform Hajj nor Umrah nor undertake a journey.' He said: 'Perform Hajj on behalf of your father and perform Umrah.'"
question: What is the significance of fulfilling religious duties on behalf of one's parents in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet was asked about whether Umrah was obligatory? He said: "No. But if you perform Umrah it is more virtuous."
question: What did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) say about the obligation of Umrah?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet said: "Umrah has been entered into Hajj until the Day of Resurrection."
question: What are the implications of Umrah being part of Hajj until the Day of Resurrection?

hadith-eng:
"Umrah to 'Umrah atones for the
sins between them, and for A1-Hajj
Al-Mabrur there is no reward
except Paradise."
question: What does the term 'Al-Hajj Al-Mabrur' imply in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet ordered Abdur-RAhman bin Abi Bakr to (accompany) Aishah to perform Umrah from At-Tan'im."
question: How does this narration illustrate the Prophet's guidance in religious rituals?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah left Al-Ji'irranah during the night for Umrah, then he entered Makkah during he night and performed his Umrah. Then he left there during the night, then he was in Al-Ji'irranah by the morning, as if he had spent the night. When the sun passed the zenith in the morning he left from the midst of Sarif until he came on a road from amidst Sarif. It is because of this that his Umrah was concealed from the people."
question: What is the importance of timing in the performance of Umrah as demonstrated by the Prophet?

hadith-eng: Ibn Umar was asked: In which month did the Messenger of Allah perform Umrah? He said: 'During Rajab.' So Aishah said: 'The Messenger of Allah did not perform Umrah except that he was with him - meaning Ibn Umar - and he did not ever perform Umrah in the month of Rajab.'"
question: How do discrepancies in narrations among companions affect the understanding of Islamic practices?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Umrah four times, one of them was during Rajab."
question: How does the frequency of the Prophet's Umrah reflect on its importance in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Umrah during Dhul-Qa'dah."
question: What are the virtues of performing Umrah in the month of Dhul-Qa'dah?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Umrah during Ramadan is equal to Hajj."
question: In what ways does the timing of Umrah affect its spiritual value and reward?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever suffers a fracture or becomes lame them he (leaves the state of Ihram) and is required to perform another Hajj." I (Ikrimah) mentioned that to Abu Hurairah and Ibn Abbas and they said: "He told the truth."
question: What are the conditions under which a person can leave the state of Ihram?

hadith-eng: "Duba'ah bint Az-Zubair came to the prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I want to perform Hajj so should I state a condition?' He said: 'Yes.' She asked: 'So how should I say it?' He said: 'Say; "Labbaik Allahumma labbaika mahilli minal Ard haithu tahbisuni (I respond to Your call O Allah, I respond to Your call, I will exit Ihram any where on the earth where You prevent me."
question: How does one properly exit the state of Ihram if prevented from completing Hajj?

hadith-eng: His father disliked making a condition during Hajj and he said: 'Is not the Sunnah of your Prophet enough for you?"
question: What are the potential implications of deviating from the Sunnah in Islamic rituals?

hadith-eng: "It was mentioned to the Messenger of Allah that Safiyyah bint Huyai got her menses during the days of Mina, so he said: "Will she prevent us (from departing)?" They said: "She has done (Tawaf) Al-Ifadah/" So the Messenger of Allah said: "In that case there is no harm."
question: What is the ruling on completing Hajj rituals if a woman starts her menses after performing Tawaf Al-Ifadah?

hadith-eng: "Whoever performs Hajj to the House, then let the last of their acts be at the House, except for menstruating women. The Messenger of Allah gave them permission (to leave)." (Sahih Mawquf)
question: What permissions did the Prophet Muhammad give to menstruating women during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "I got my menses do the Prophet ordered me to carry out all the rites except for Tawaf around the House."
question: What guidance did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) provide regarding women performing rites during menstruation?

hadith-eng: "I heard the Prophet saying: 'Whoever performs Hajj to this House, or Umrah, then let the last of his acts be at the House'" So Umar said: "May your hand be humiliated! You heard this from the Messenger of Allah but did not inform us of it?"
question: What can be inferred about Umar's reaction to not being informed about a specific hadith?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah performed Qaran for Hajj and Umrah, so he performed one Tawaf for both of them."
question: What is the significance of combining Hajj and Umrah in Islamic pilgrimage?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever assumes Ihram for Hajj and Umrah, then it is acceptable for him to perform one Tawaf and one Sa'I for them both, until he exits Ihram for both of them together."
question: What are the conditions for combining Hajj and Umrah in a single pilgrimage?

hadith-eng: (that the Prophet said): "The Muhajir may stay for three (days) in Makkah after carrying out his rites."
question: What are the implications of the Prophet's guidance on the temporary stay of a Muhajir in Makkah?

hadith-eng: "When the Prophet would come home from a battle, or Hajj, or Umrah, when he was it a tract of land or raised area he would say 'Allahu Akbar (Allah is Most Great)' three times, then say: 'La Ilaha illallah Wahdahu la sharika lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-Hamdu wa Huwa ala kulli shai'in qadir. A'ibuna ta'ibun abidun saa'ihuna li Rabbina Hamiduna, Sadaqallahu wa'dahu wa nasara abdahu wa hazamal-ahzab Wahdah. (None has the right to be worshiped but Allah Alone without partners. To Him belongs the sovereignty and to Him belongs the praise, and He has power over all things. We are returning, repenting, worshipping, traveling for our Lord, and we are praising. Allah has told the truth, and kept His promise and helped His worshipper, and routed the confederates, Alone.'"
question: What are the attributes of Allah mentioned in the supplication recited by the Prophet upon returning from a journey?

hadith-eng: "We were with the Messenger of Allah on a journey when he saw a man fall from his camel, his neck was broken and he died, and he was a Muhrim. So the Messenger of Allah said: 'Wash him with water and Sidr, and shroud him in his garments, and do not cover his head. For indeed he will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment saying the Talbiyah.'"
question: How does the state of Ihram affect the resurrection of a person on the Day of Judgment?

hadith-eng: Umar bin Ubaidullah bin Ma'mar was complaining about his eyes while he was a Muhrim. He asked Aban bin Uthman about it and he said: "Bandage it with some aloes, for I heard Uthman bin Affan mentioning that the Messenger of Allah said: 'Bandage it with aloes.'"
question: What role do companions of the Prophet play in transmitting medical advice in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet passed by him while he was at Al-Hudaibiyah, before entering Makkah, and he was a Muhrim. He had lit a fire under a cooking pot and lice were falling all over his face. So he (the Prophet) said: "Have these lice of yours troubled you?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Shave and feed six of the poor with a Faraq" and a Faraq is three Sa - "or fast three days, or slaughter a sacrifice." Ibn Abi Najih (one of the narrators) said: "Or slaughter a sheep."
question: What is the role of fasting as a form of compensation for a Muhrim in distress?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet permitted the shepherds to stone a day and leave a day."
question: In what ways does Islamic law consider the practical challenges faced by individuals in their professions?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah permitted the camel herders who were in the camp (at Mina) to stone on the Day of An-Nahr then to gather the stoning of two days after the Day of An-Nahr, so that they stoned them during one of them." Malik said: "I think that he said about the first of them: 'They they should stone on the day of departure.'"
question: How does the concept of flexibility in religious practices manifest in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "When Ali returned to the Messenger of Allah from Yemen he said: 'For what did you intended the Talbiyah?' He replied: 'I intended the Talbiyah for what the Messenger of Allah announced it.' So he (pbuh) said: 'If I did not have the Hadi with me then I would exit Ihram.'"
question: What does this narration imply about the relationship between Ali and the Prophet Muhammad regarding religious practices?

hadith-eng: "I asked the Messenger of Allah about the day of Al-Hajj Al-Akbar and he said: 'They Day of An-Nahr.'"
question: Why is the Day of An-Nahr considered important in the context of Hajj?

hadith-eng: "They day of Al-Hajj Al-Akbar is the Day of An-Nahr."
question: Why is the Day of An-Nahr referred to as the Day of Al-Hajj Al-Akbar?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Umar was clinging on the two corners (in a manner that I had not seen any of the Companions of the Prophet doing) so I said: 'O Abu Abdur-Rahman! You are clinging on the two corners in a manner that I have not seen any of the Companions of the Prophet clining.' So he said: 'I do it because I heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "Touching them atones for sins." And I heard him saying: "Whoever performs Tawaf around this House seven times and he keeps track of it, then it is as if he freed a slave." And I heard him saying: "One foot is not put down, nor another raised except that Allah removes a sin from him and records a good merit for him."
question: Why might Ibn Umar have practiced clinging to the two corners differently from other Companions of the Prophet?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "Tawaf around the House is similar to Salat except that you talk during it. So whoever talks in it, then let him not say but good."
question: Why is it important to speak only good words during Tawaf?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said about the (Black) Stone: "By Allah! Allah will raise it on the Day of Resurrection with two eyes by which it sees and a tongue that it speaks with, testifying to whoever touched it in truth."
question: How does the Black Stone serve as a witness on the Day of Judgment?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would apply oil that is not scented (Ghair Muqattat) while he was a Muhrim."
question: Why might scented products be avoided during the state of Ihram?

hadith-eng: from his father about Aishah, that she would carry some Zamzam water, and she would say: "Indeed the Messenger of Allah would carry it."
question: Why might a person choose to carry Zamzam water based on historical practices?

hadith-eng: "I said to Anas bin Malik: 'Narrated something to me that you understand about where the Messenger of Allah performed Zuhr on the Day of Tarwiyah.' He said: 'In Mina.'" "I said: 'So where did he pray Asr on the day of departure?' He said: 'In Al-Abtab.' Then he said: 'Do what your leaders do.'"
question: What is the significance of the locations Mina and Al-Abtab in the context of this narration?

hadith-eng: "Abu Shuraih Al-Adawi said tat when Amr bin Sa'eed was sending troops to Makkah he said to him: 'O Amr! Allow me to tell you what the Messenger of Allah said on the day following the Conquest of Makkah. My ears heard it, my heard understood it thoroughly, and with my own eyes, I saw the Prophet when he - after glorifying and praising Allah - said: "Indeed Allah, the Most High, made Makkah a sanctuary, it was not made a sanctuary by the people. So it is not lawful for a man who believes in Allah and the Last Day to shed blood it, nor to cut down its trees. If anybody tries to use the Messenger of Allah to make an excuse for fighting in it, then say to him: 'Indeed Allah permitted His Messenger and He did not permit you.' Allah only allowed it for me for a few hours of one day, and today its sanctity has returned as it was before. So let the one who is present convey to the one who is absent." Abu Shuraih was asked: "What was Amr bin Sa'eeds reply to you?" He said: "I am more knowledgeable about that than you Abu Shuraih! The Haram does not give protection to a disobedient person, nor a person fleeing for murder, nor fleeing for (Kharbah) lawlessness."
question: What responsibilities do Muslims have in conveying the teachings about the sanctity of Makkah to others?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Alternate between Hajj and Umrah; for those two remove poverty and sins just as the bellows removes filth from iron, gold, and silver - and there is no reward for Al-Hajj Al-Mabrur except for Paradise."
question: What is the ultimate reward for performing an accepted Hajj according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever performs Hajj for Allah, and he does not have sexual relations nor commit any sin, then his previous sins will be forgiven."
question: How does the intention behind performing Hajj affect its outcome in terms of sin forgiveness?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever has the provisions and the means to convey him to Allah's House and he does not perform Hajj, then it does not matter if he dies as a Jew or a Christian. That is because Allah said in His Book: 'And Hajj to the House is a duty that mankind owes to Allah, for whomever is able to bear the journey.'
question: What are the conditions that make Hajj obligatory for a Muslim?

hadith-eng: "When Allah revealed: And Hajj to the House is a duty that mankind owes to Allah, for whomever is able to bear the journey. They said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Is that every year?' He remained silent. So they said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Is that every year?' He said: 'No. If I had said yes, then it would have been made obligatory.' So Allah revealed: O you who believe! Do not ask about things which, if made plain to you, may cause you trouble.
question: How does the concept of divine revelation influence the obligations of Islamic practices?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Hajj three times. He performed Hajj twice before his emigration, and he performed one Hajj after he emigrated, and these were accompanied by Umrah. So he drove sixty-three sacrificial animals (Budn) and Ali came from Yemen with the rest of them, among them was a camel of Abu Jahl that has a ring made of silver in its nose. So he (the Messenger of Allah) slaughtered the, and the Messenger of Allah ordered that a piece of each of them be cooked, and he drank from its broth."
question: What did the Prophet do with the sacrificial animals after slaughtering them during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah performed four Umrah: The Umrah of Al-Hudaibiyah, a second Umrah the following (year), (which was) the Umrah of Al-Qisas during Dhul-Qa'dah, a third Umrah from Al-Ji'irranah, and the fourth which accompanied his Hajj."
question: What is the historical context of the Umrah of Al-Hudaibiyah?

hadith-eng: "When the Prophet wanted to Perform Hajj, he announced it to the people, and they gathered (to accompany him). When he reached Al-Baida he assumed Ihram"
question: How does the process of assuming Ihram begin during the Hajj pilgrimage?

hadith-eng: "Al-Baida the one they lie about regarding the Messenger of Allah. By Allah! The Messenger of Allah did not start the Talbiyah except from near the Masjid, near the tree."
question: What is the Talbiyah and when is it traditionally recited during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah performed Tamattu, as did Abu Bakr, Umar and Uthman. And the first to prohibit it was Mu'awiyah."
question: What are the implications of prohibiting a religious practice that was performed by the Prophet and his companions?

hadith-eng: He heard Sa'd bin Abi Waqas, and Ad-Dahhak bin Qais while they were mentioning Tamattu after "Umrah until Hajj. Ad-Dahhak bin Qais said: "No one does that except one who is ignorant of the order of Allah, Most High." Sa'd said: "How horrible is it what you have said O my nephew!" So Ad-Dahhak (bin Qais) said: "Indeed Umar bin Al-Khattab has prohibited that." So Sa'd said: "The Messenger of Allah did it, and we did it with him."
question: What can be inferred about the differences in opinion among the companions regarding Tamattu?

hadith-eng: he had heard a man from Ash-Sham asking Abdullah bin Umar about Tamattu after Umrah until Hajj, so Abdullah bin Umar said: "It is lawful." The man from Ash-Sham said: "But your father prohibited it." So Abdullah bin Umar said: "Is the order to follow my father or is the order (to follow) for the Messenger of Allah?" The man said: "Rather it is for the Messenger of Allah." So he said: "Indeed the Messenger of Allah did it."
question: What does this narration illustrate about the role of personal interpretation versus prophetic example in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet would say the following for the Talbiyah: "Labbaik Allahumma labbaik. Labbaik la sharika laka labbaik. Innal-hamda wan-ni;mata laka wal-mulk, la sharika laka." ('I respond to Your call O Allah! I respond to Your call. You have no partner. I respond to Your call. All praise, thanks and blessings are for You. All sovereignty is for You. And You have no partners with You).'"
question: What does the Talbiyah express about the sovereignty and blessings of Allah?

hadith-eng: When Ibn Umar would say thetalbiyahhe would continue saying: "Labbaik Allahumma labbaik. Labbaik la sharika laka labbaik. Innal-hamda wan-ni`mata laka wal-mulk, la sharika laka" (I respond to Your call O Allah! I respond to Your call, You have no partner, I respond to You call. All praise, thanks and blessings are for You. And You have no partners with You). He said: "Abdullah bin Umar would say: 'This is theTalbiyahof the Messenger of Allah.' He would himself add the following after theTalbiyahof the Messenger of Allah: "Labbaik labbaika wa-sa'daik, wal-khairuu fi yadaik. Labbaika war-raghba'u ilaika wal-amal" ('I respond to Your call, and I am obedient to Your orders, all good is in Your Hands. I respond to Your call and the requests and deeds are for You).'"
question: What additional phrases did Ibn Umar include in his Talbiyah and what do they mean?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah was asked: "Which Hajj is the most virtuous?" He said: "That with raised voices (Al-Ajj) and the flow of blood (of the sacrifice) (Ath-Thajj)."
question: What actions during Hajj are considered to enhance its virtue?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "There is no Muslim who says the Talbiyah except that - on his right and left, until the end f the land, from here to there - the rocks, or trees, or mud say the Talbiyah."
question: How does the concept of Talbiyah reflect the relationship between humans and the natural world in Islam?

hadith-eng: Who said that the Messenger of Allah said: "Jibril came to me and ordered me to order my Companions to raise their voices with the Ihlal, or; the Talbiyah."
question: What is the Talbiyah and when is it recited during Islamic rituals?

hadith-eng: A man said: "Where should we begin our Hil (Ihram) O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "The people of Al-Madinah begin their Hil (Ihram) from Dhul-Hulaifah, the people from Ash-Sham from Al-Juhfah, and the people of Najd from Qarn." And he (Ibn Umar) said: ("And they say:) "And the people of Yemen from Yalamlam."
question: How do the designated Ihram locations reflect the geographical considerations for pilgrims?

hadith-eng: "A man stood and said 'O Messenger of Allah! What clothing do you command us to wear in Al-Haram?' The Messenger of Allah said: 'Do not wear shirts, nor pants, nor burnooses, nor turbans, nor Khuff - unless one does not have any sandals, then let him wear Khuff, but let him cut them below the ankles. And do not wear any cloth that has been touched by saffron or Wars. And the woman in Ihram is not to cover her face, nor wear gloves.'"
question: What is the significance of cutting Khuff below the ankles during Ihram?

hadith-eng: He heard the Messenger of Allah say: "If the Muhrim cannot find an Izar, then let him wear pants, and if he cannot find sandals, them let him wear Khuff."
question: What are the guidelines for a Muhrim regarding footwear during Ihram?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah saw a Bedouin who was in Ihram wearing a cloak. So he ordered him to remove it."
question: What are the consequences of not adhering to the dress code during Ihram?

hadith-eng: the Messenger of Allah said: "Five are Fawasiq which may be killed in the Haram: the mouse, the scorpion, the crow, the kite, and the barbed dog."
question: What are the implications of killing harmful animals in the Haram on the sanctity of the place?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The Muhrim may kill the wild beast of prey, the rabid dog, the mouse, the scorpion, the kite, and the crow."
question: What are the implications of this ruling on the understanding of harm and protection in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah was cupped while he was a Muhrim."
question: How does the practice of cupping align with the Sunnah of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him)?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Ma'mar wanted to have his son married. S he sent me to Aban bin Uthman who was the Amir of the (Hajj) season. I went to him and said: 'Your brother wants to marry his son and he would like for you to witness that.' He said: 'I think he is but a crude Bedouin; indeed the Muhrim is not to marry nor have someone married'" - or he said similarly - then he narrated from Uthman similar in Marfu form (from the Prophet).
question: How are narrations from companions like Uthman used to derive Islamic rulings?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah married Maimunah while he was Halal, and he stayed with her while he was Halal, and I was the messenger between the two of them."
question: What are the implications of the Prophet Muhammad's marriages on Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet married Maimunah while he was a Muhrim."
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's marriage to Maimunah in terms of Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet married Maimunah while he was a Muhrim."
question: How do scholars interpret the permissibility of marriage during the state of Ihram based on this event?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet married Maimunah while he was a Muhrim."
question: How does this event reflect on the personal life of the Prophet and his adherence to Islamic practices?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah married he while he was Halal and he stayed with her while he was Halal. She died in Sarif, and we buried her at the (site of the) tent where he had stayed wit her."
question: What are the implications of the Prophet's (ﷺ) actions on Islamic burial practices?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "The land game is lawful for you while you are in Ihram as long as you did not hunt it - or - it was not hunted for you."
question: What types of game are considered lawful for those in Ihram?

hadith-eng: He was with the Prophet and when he got to one of the roads of Makkah some of the companions were Muhrim and he (Abu Qatadah) was not a Muhrim. So he saw a wild donkey, so he mounted his horse, asked his companions to give him his whip but they refused, so he asked them to give him his spear and they refused. So he (himself) took it and struck the donkey killing it. Some of the Companions of the Prophet ate it and some of them refused. When they caught up to the Prophet they asked him about that and he said: "It is only food which Allah fed you."
question: What can be learned about the companions' adherence to the rules of Ihram from this incident?

hadith-eng: As-S'ab bin Jath-thamah informed him that the Messenger of Allah had passed him at Al-Abwa or Bawaddan. He (As-S'ab) gave him a wild donkey but he refused it. When the Messenger of Allah noticed on his face that he was upset, he said: "We would not refuse you, but we are in Ihram"
question: What is the appropriate way to handle a situation where a gift cannot be accepted due to religious obligations?

hadith-eng: "We went with the Messenger of Allah during Hajj or Umrah and we encountered a swarm of locusts. We began striking at them with our whips and set our staffs, and the Prophet said: "Eat it, for indeed it is game of the sea."
question: How does the classification of locusts as permissible food relate to Islamic dietary guidelines?

hadith-eng: "I asked Jabir bin Abdullah: 'Is the hyena game?' He said: 'Yes'" He said: "I said: 'Can it be eaten?' He said: 'Yes.'" He said: "I said: 'Did the Messenger of Allah say that?' He said: 'Yes.'"
question: How does Islamic jurisprudence determine what animals are permissible to eat?

hadith-eng: "When the Prophet arrived in Makkah, he entered the Masjid and touched the (Black) Stone, then went to his right and performed Raml (walking quickly) for three (circuits) and walking for four. Then he came to the Maqam and said: 'And take you (people) the Maqam (place) of Ibrahim as a place of prayer.' Then he performed two Rak'ah while the Maqam was between him and the House. Then he came to the (Black) Stone after the two Rak'ah to touch it, then he left to As-Safa - I think - he said: Indeed As-Safa and Al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah."
question: What is the significance of performing two Rak'ah with the Maqam between the person and the House?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Raml from the (Black) Stone to the (Black) Stone for three (circuits), and he walked four (circuits)."
question: How does the practice of Raml differ from walking during Tawaf?

hadith-eng: "I was with Ibn Abbas, and Mu'awiyah would not pass any corner without touching it. So Ibn Abbas said to him: 'the Prophet would not touch any besides the Black Stone and the Yemeni corner.' So Mu'awiyah said: 'There is no part of the House that is untouchable.'"
question: What does this narration suggest about the importance of following the Prophet's practices in Islamic rituals?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Tawaf of the House Mudtabi'an, and he was wearing a Burd."
question: What is the importance of following the Prophet's example in religious rituals?

hadith-eng: "I saw Umar bin Al-Khattab kissing the (Black) Stone and saying: 'I am kissing you while I know that you are just a stone, and if I had not seen the Messenger of Allah kissing you, I would not kiss you.'"
question: How can the actions of the Prophet Muhammad influence the practices of his followers?

hadith-eng: That a man asked Ibn Umar about touching the (Black) Stone, so he said: "I saw the Prophet touching it and kissing it." So the man said: "What is your view if there is a throng (around the Ka'bah) and what is your view if the people overpowered me?" Ibn Umar said: "Leave 'What is your view' in Yemen. I saw the Prophet touching it and kissing it."
question: What can be inferred about the importance of following the Prophet's actions in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: "When the Prophet arrived in Makkah, he performed seven (circuits) of Tawaf around the House. Then he came to the Maqam and said:  And take you (people) the Maqam (place) of Ibrahim as a place of prayer. Then he prayed behind the Maqam. Then he came to the (Black) Stone to touch it. Then he said: 'We begin with what Allah began with.' So he began at As-Safa and recited: Indeed As-Safa and Al-Marwah are among the Symbols of Allah."
question: How are As-Safa and Al-Marwah regarded as symbols of Allah in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "I saw Ibn Umar walking at the place of Sa'i so I said to him: 'Do you walk at the place of Sa'i between As-Safa and Al-Marwah?' He said: 'If I performed Sa'i, then it is because I saw the Messenger of Allah performing Sa'i there, and if I walked, then it is because I have seen the Messenger of Allah walking. And I am an old man.'"
question: How do personal circumstances, such as age, influence the performance of religious duties in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Tawaf upon his mount, so when he arrived at the (Black Stone) corner, he pointed to it."
question: What does this narration suggest about the flexibility in performing Tawaf for those with physical limitations?

hadith-eng: "Whoever performed Tawaf around the House fifty time, he will be as free of his sins as the day his mother bore him."
question: What does the comparison to the day a person is born signify in terms of spiritual purity?

hadith-eng: "We considered Abdullah bin Sa'eed bin Jubair to be better than his father, and he had a brother named Abdul-Malik bin Sa'eed bin Jubair who also reported from him."
question: What role did personal opinions play in assessing the credibility of hadith narrators?

hadith-eng: the Prophet said: "O Banu Abd Manaf! Do not prevent anyone from performing Tawaf around this House, and Salat, whichever hour it is of the night or day."
question: What does this teaching suggest about the relationship between the Banu Abd Manaf and the pilgrims?

hadith-eng: During the two Rak'ah of Tawaf, the Messenger of Allah recited the two Surat of Ikhlas, "Say: O you disbelievers!" and: "Say: He is Allah, (the) One."
question: Why might the Prophet have chosen these particular Surahs for the Tawaf prayer?

hadith-eng: XI asked Ali: "What is it that you were sent with?" He said: "With four things: None will be admitted into Paradise except for the soul that is a Muslim. None is to perform Tawaf around the House while naked. The Muslims and the idolaters will not be gathering (in Makkah) together after this year. And for whomever there is a covenant between him and the Prophet, then his covenant is (valid) until its term, and for that in which there was no term, then it shall be four months."
question: What is the stipulated duration for covenants without a specified term according to this narration?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet left me while he had a joyous look of contentment and he returned to me grieving. So I asked him about that and he said: 'I entered the Ka'bah, and I wished that I had not done it. I fear that my Ummah will follow me (in that) after me.'"
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's consideration for his followers from this incident?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet performed Salat in the interior of the Ka'bah." And Ibn Abbas said: "He did not perform Salat in it, but he said the Takbir."
question: How do scholars reconcile differing narrations about the same event in Islamic history?

hadith-eng: Ibn Az-Zubair said to him: "Narrated to me from what the Mother of the Believers used to (secretly) inform you about" - meaning Aishah - so he said: "She narrated to me that the Messenger of Allah said: 'Had your people not been still close to the pre-Islamic period of ignorance, then I would demolish the Ka'bah and rebuild it with two doors.'" He said: "So when Ibn Az-Zubair came to power he demolished it and rebuilt it with two doors."
question: What significance did the two doors of the Ka'bah hold in the Prophet's vision?

hadith-eng: "I wanted to enter the House to perform Salat in it, so the Messenger of Allah took me by the hand and put me in the Hijr, and he said: 'Perform Salat in the Hijri if you want to enter the House. For indeed it is part of the House, but your people considered it insignificant when they built the Ka'bah, so they put it outside the House.'"
question: What does the Prophet's guidance about the Hijr indicate about its religious importance?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "The Black Stone descended from the Paradise, and it was more white than milk, then it was blackened by the sins of the children of Adam."
question: How is the concept of sin and its impact illustrated through the story of the Black Stone?

hadith-eng: He heard the Messenger of Allah saying: "Indeed the Corner and the Maqam are two corundums from the corundum of Paradise. Allah removed their lights, and if their lights had not been removed then they would illuminate what is between east and the west."
question: How does the description of the Corner and the Maqam reflect their spiritual importance?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah led us in Salat at Mina for Zuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha, and Fajr, then he left in the morning to Arafat."
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's movements during the Hajj from this narration?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet prayed Zuhr and Fajr in Mina, then he left in the morning to Arafat.
question: How do the actions of the Prophet during Hajj influence Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Mirba Al-Ansari came to us while we were standing at our places" (Amr bin Sinar said:) a place that Amr (bin Abdullah) indicated was far - "and he said: 'I am a messenger whom the Messenger of Allah sent to you to say: 'Stay with your (Hajj) rites, for indeed you are following a legacy left by Ibrahim.'"
question: What is the role of the Prophet Muhammad in conveying the practices of previous prophets?

hadith-eng: "The Quraish and those who followed their religion - and they were called Al-Hums - would stand at Al-Muzdalifah, and they would say: 'We are the people of Allah.' The others would stand at Arafat, so Allah the Mighty and Sublime revealed: Then depart from where the people depart."
question: How did the revelation address the differences in pilgrimage practices between the Quraish and others?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah stopped at Arafat and said: 'This is Arafah and it is a place of standing. And all of Arafat is a place for standing.' Then he departed when the sun had set and took Usamah bin Zaid as a companion rider, and he was motioning with his hand as was his custom, and the people were striking (their camels) on the right and the left to try and catch them, so he said: 'O you people! Be calmm.' Then he came to Jama and performed the two Salat there combined. When the morning came, he went to Quzah and stood there and said: 'This is Quzah, and it is a place of standing, and all of Jama is a place for standing.' Then he departed until he arrived at Wadi Muhassir. Then he stuck his she-camel and she trotted until he passed the valley. Then he stopped and took Al-Fadl as a companion rider and went to the Jamrah to stone it. Then he went to Al-Manhar and said: 'This is Al-Manhar, and all of Mina is a place for sacrifice.' A young girl from Khath'am came to ask him for a verdict, she said: 'Indeed my father is an elderly man who has lived until Allah has made Hajj obligatory, so would he be rewarded if I perform Hajj for him? He said: 'Perform Hajj for your father.'" He said: "And he turned the neck of Al Fadl. So Al-Abbas said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Why did you turn the neck of your cousin?' He said: 'I saw a young man and a young woman, and they were not safe from Shaitan.' A man came to him and said, 'O Messenger of Allah! I performed (Tawaf) Al-Ifadah before shaving.' He said: 'Shave, and there is no harm'" - or: 'Clip and there is no harm'" He said: "Someone else came and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I did the sacrifice before stoning.' So he said: 'Stone, and there is no harm.'" He said: "Then he went to the House (Ka'bah) to perform Tawaf around it, then he went to Zamzam and said: 'O tribe of Abdul-Muttalib! If it were not that the people would rush upon you then I would remove it.'"
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) address issues related to the sequence of Hajj rituals?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet hurried through Wadi Muhassir." Bishr (one of the narrators) added: "He departed from Jam calmly and he ordered them (the people) to be calm." And Abu Nu'aim (one of the narrators) added: "And he ordered them to do the stoning with what was similar to pebbles for Al-Khadhf' And he said: "Perhaps I will not see you after this year."
question: How does the Prophet's guidance during Hajj reflect on the conduct of rituals?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Umar prayed at Jam (Muzdalifah), so he combined two prayers with the Iqamah, and he said: 'I saw the Messenger of Allah doing the same as this at the place.'"
question: What can be learned from Ibn Umar's observation of the Prophet's actions at Muzdalifah?

hadith-eng: Similarly from Ibn Umar, from the Prophet.
question: How are hadiths categorized in Islamic literature?

hadith-eng: Some people among the residents of Najd came to the Messenger of Allah while he was at Arafat. They were questioning him, so he ordered a caller to proclaim: "The Hajj is Arafah. Whoever came to Jam during the night, before the time of Fajr, then he has attended the Hajj. The days of Mina are three, so whoever hastens (leaving after) two days, then there is no sin upon him, and whoever delays, then there is no sin upon him." Muhammad said: "Yahya added: 'And he took a companion rider to proclaim it.'"
question: What is the role of a caller in communicating important messages during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "I came to the Messenger of Allah at Al-Muzdalifah when he left for the Salat. I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I came from the two mountains of (the tribe of) Tai, wearing out my mount and exhausting myself. By Allah! I did not leave a Habl (sand dune) without stopping on it. So is there Hajj for me?' The Messenger of Allah said: 'Whoever attends this Salat of ours, and stays here with us until departing, while he has stood during the night or the day before that at Arafat, then he has completed his Hajj and fulfilled his Tafath.'"
question: What actions are required to fulfill the Tafath during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet advanced the weak among his family and he said: 'Do not stone the Jamrah until the sun has risen.'"
question: How does this practice demonstrate the balance between ritual observance and compassion?

hadith-eng: "We were halted at Jama when Umar bin Al-Khattab said: 'The idolaters would not depart until the sun had risen and they would say: "Let the sun shine on Thabir" and indeed the Messenger of Allah contradicted them.' So Umar departed before the rising of the sun."
question: How does this narration reflect the importance of distinguishing Islamic practices from those of idolaters?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Messenger of Allah stoning the Jimar with what was similar to pebbles for Al-Khadhaf."
question: What are the symbolic meanings associated with the stoning ritual in Hajj?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah stoned the Jimar when the sun had passed the zenith."
question: What are the specific actions involved in the ritual of stoning the Jimar?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet stoned the Jamrah on the Day of An-Nahr while riding."
question: What lessons can be learned from the Prophet's actions during the stoning of the Jamrah?

hadith-eng: "When Abdullah went to stone Jamrat Al-Aqabah, he went to the middle of the valley, faced the Ka'bah, and proceeded to stone the Jamrah at its southern wall. Then he stoned with seven pebbles, saying: "Allahu Akbar" with each pebble. Then he said: 'By Allah except Whom none is worthy of worship. This is where the one stoned to whom Surat Al-Baqarah was revealed.'"
question: What connection does the stoning ritual have with the revelation of Surat Al-Baqarah?

hadith-eng: The Prophet said: "Stoning the Jimari and Sa'i between As-Safa and Al-Marwah are only done for the establishment of Allah's remembrance."
question: How do the rituals of Hajj contribute to the spiritual remembrance of Allah?

hadith-eng: "I saw the Prophet stoning the Jimar upon his she-camel; there was no hitting, nor crowding, nor: 'Look out! Look out!'"
question: What significance does the Prophet's use of a she-camel have during the stoning of the Jimar?

hadith-eng: "We slaughtered with the Messenger of Allah during the year of Al-Hudaibiyah: a cow for seven, and a Badanah for seven."
question: How does the practice of animal sacrifice during Hajj demonstrate the spirit of unity among Muslims?

hadith-eng: "We were with the Prophet on a journey (on the Day of) Adha, so seven of us shared in a cow, and ten for a camel."
question: What are the guidelines for distributing shares in sacrificial animals during Eid al-Adha?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet garlanded two sandals and marked the Hadi on the right side at Dhul-Hulaifah, and removed the blood from it."
question: How does the marking of the Hadi relate to the rituals of Hajj or Umrah?

hadith-eng: "I twisted the garlands for the Hadi of the Prophet, then he did not assume Ihram, nor did he avoid any clothing."
question: How does this narration reflect on the flexibility of Ihram rules in certain situations?

hadith-eng: "I twisted the garlands for all of the Hadi of the Messenger of Allah, which were sheep, then he did not assume Ihram."
question: What can be inferred about the Messenger of Allah's approach to Hadi from this narration?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet saw a man driving his Badanah so he said to him: "Ride it." He said: "O Messenger of Allah! It is a Badanah." So on the third or fourth time he said to him: "Ride it. And woe to you!"
question: What lessons can be learned about obedience and respect for the Prophet's (ﷺ) instructions?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah stoned the Jamrah, he slaughtered his sacrifice, then he presented the barber the right side (of his head) and he shaved it, then he gave (the hair) to Abu Talhah. Then he presented the left side to him and he shaved it. Then he said: 'Divide it (the hair) among the people.'"
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's practice of sharing his personal belongings with his companions?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "May Allah have mercy upon those who shaved" saying it one or two times, then he said: "And those who shortened."
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's emphasis on shaving from this narration?

hadith-eng: "A man asked the Messenger of Allah: 'I shaved before slaughtering.' So he said: 'Slaughter, and there is no harm.' Another man asked him: 'I performed the sacrifice before stoning.' He said: 'Stone, and there is no harm.'"
question: What does this hadith teach about the permissibility of actions during Hajj if done out of order?

hadith-eng: "I put perfume with musk in it on the Messenger of Allah before he assumed Ihram, and on the Day of An-Nahr before he performed Tawaf around the House."
question: How does the timing of applying perfume relate to the rituals of Hajj?

hadith-eng: "I was a companion rider with the Messenger of Allah from Jam to Mina. He did not cease saying the Talbiyah until stoning Jamrat Al-Aqabah."
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's practice of saying the Talbiyah continuously until a specific ritual?

hadith-eng: (that the Prophet): "Would stop saying the Talbiyah during "Umrah when he touched the (Black) Stone."
question: What actions are associated with the Talbiyah during the pilgrimage rituals?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet delayed the visiting Tawaf until the night."
question: How does the practice of Tawaf reflect the flexibility in Islamic rituals?

hadith-eng: "A woman held a boy of hers up for the Messenger of Allah and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Is there Hajj for this one' He said: 'Yes, and you will be rewarded.'"
question: What are the benefits for parents when their children participate in Hajj?

hadith-eng: "My father took me for Hajj with the Messenger of Allah during the Farewell Hajj, and I was seven years old."
question: What lessons can be learned from the experience of participating in Hajj at a young age?

hadith-eng: "When we performed our Hajj with the Prophet we would say the Talbiyah for the women and we would stone for the boys."
question: How did the companions ensure the participation of boys in the Hajj rituals?

hadith-eng: "A woman from Khath'am said: 'O Messenger of Allah! My father has lived until Allah has made Hajj obligatory, and he is an elderly man who is not able to sit on the back of a camel.' So he (pbuh) said: 'Perform Hajj for him.'"
question: How does the concept of proxy worship apply in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: "A woman came to the Prophet and said: 'My mother died and she did not perform Hajj should I perform Hajj on her behalf?' He said: 'Yes, perform Hajj on her behalf.'"
question: What is the significance of performing Hajj for a deceased relative in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: That he went to the Prophet and said: "O Messenger of Allah! My father is an elderly man who is not able to perform Hajj nor Umrah nor undertake a journey.' He said: 'Perform Hajj on behalf of your father and perform Umrah.'"
question: How does the concept of proxy pilgrimage reflect the values of compassion and responsibility in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet was asked about whether Umrah was obligatory? He said: "No. But if you perform Umrah it is more virtuous."
question: What is the significance of asking the Prophet about religious obligations?

hadith-eng:
"Umrah to 'Umrah atones for the
sins between them, and for A1-Hajj
Al-Mabrur there is no reward
except Paradise."
question: How does the concept of reward in Paradise relate to the performance of Hajj?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah left Al-Ji'irranah during the night for Umrah, then he entered Makkah during he night and performed his Umrah. Then he left there during the night, then he was in Al-Ji'irranah by the morning, as if he had spent the night. When the sun passed the zenith in the morning he left from the midst of Sarif until he came on a road from amidst Sarif. It is because of this that his Umrah was concealed from the people."
question: How does the Prophet's journey from Al-Ji'irranah to Makkah illustrate the concept of privacy in religious practices?

hadith-eng: Ibn Umar was asked: In which month did the Messenger of Allah perform Umrah? He said: 'During Rajab.' So Aishah said: 'The Messenger of Allah did not perform Umrah except that he was with him - meaning Ibn Umar - and he did not ever perform Umrah in the month of Rajab.'"
question: What is the importance of verifying information from multiple sources in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever suffers a fracture or becomes lame them he (leaves the state of Ihram) and is required to perform another Hajj." I (Ikrimah) mentioned that to Abu Hurairah and Ibn Abbas and they said: "He told the truth."
question: What is the role of truthfulness in confirming the authenticity of a hadith?

hadith-eng: "Duba'ah bint Az-Zubair came to the prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I want to perform Hajj so should I state a condition?' He said: 'Yes.' She asked: 'So how should I say it?' He said: 'Say; "Labbaik Allahumma labbaika mahilli minal Ard haithu tahbisuni (I respond to Your call O Allah, I respond to Your call, I will exit Ihram any where on the earth where You prevent me."
question: What guidance did the Prophet Muhammad provide regarding conditional statements in Hajj?

hadith-eng: "It was mentioned to the Messenger of Allah that Safiyyah bint Huyai got her menses during the days of Mina, so he said: "Will she prevent us (from departing)?" They said: "She has done (Tawaf) Al-Ifadah/" So the Messenger of Allah said: "In that case there is no harm."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) address concerns regarding menstruation during Hajj?

hadith-eng: "I heard the Prophet saying: 'Whoever performs Hajj to this House, or Umrah, then let the last of his acts be at the House'" So Umar said: "May your hand be humiliated! You heard this from the Messenger of Allah but did not inform us of it?"
question: What is the role of the Kaaba in the rituals of Hajj and Umrah?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah performed Qaran for Hajj and Umrah, so he performed one Tawaf for both of them."
question: How does the practice of Qaran differ from other forms of Hajj?

hadith-eng: The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever assumes Ihram for Hajj and Umrah, then it is acceptable for him to perform one Tawaf and one Sa'I for them both, until he exits Ihram for both of them together."
question: What is the role of Ihram in the performance of Hajj and Umrah?

hadith-eng: (that the Prophet said): "The Muhajir may stay for three (days) in Makkah after carrying out his rites."
question: How does this guidance affect the understanding of the Muhajir's relationship with Makkah post-rites?

hadith-eng: "When the Prophet would come home from a battle, or Hajj, or Umrah, when he was it a tract of land or raised area he would say 'Allahu Akbar (Allah is Most Great)' three times, then say: 'La Ilaha illallah Wahdahu la sharika lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-Hamdu wa Huwa ala kulli shai'in qadir. A'ibuna ta'ibun abidun saa'ihuna li Rabbina Hamiduna, Sadaqallahu wa'dahu wa nasara abdahu wa hazamal-ahzab Wahdah. (None has the right to be worshiped but Allah Alone without partners. To Him belongs the sovereignty and to Him belongs the praise, and He has power over all things. We are returning, repenting, worshipping, traveling for our Lord, and we are praising. Allah has told the truth, and kept His promise and helped His worshipper, and routed the confederates, Alone.'"

hadith-eng: "Abu Shuraih Al-Adawi said tat when Amr bin Sa'eed was sending troops to Makkah he said to him: 'O Amr! Allow me to tell you what the Messenger of Allah said on the day following the Conquest of Makkah. My ears heard it, my heard understood it thoroughly, and with my own eyes, I saw the Prophet when he - after glorifying and praising Allah - said: "Indeed Allah, the Most High, made Makkah a sanctuary, it was not made a sanctuary by the people. So it is not lawful for a man who believes in Allah and the Last Day to shed blood it, nor to cut down its trees. If anybody tries to use the Messenger of Allah to make an excuse for fighting in it, then say to him: 'Indeed Allah permitted His Messenger and He did not permit you.' Allah only allowed it for me for a few hours of one day, and today its sanctity has returned as it was before. So let the one who is present convey to the one who is absent." Abu Shuraih was asked: "What was Amr bin Sa'eeds reply to you?" He said: "I am more knowledgeable about that than you Abu Shuraih! hadith-eng: "When the Prophet arrived in Makkah, he entered the Masjid and touched the (Black) Stone, then went to his right and performed Raml (walking quickly) for three (circuits) and walking for four. hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah stopped at Arafat and said: 'This is Arafah and it is a place of standing. And all of Arafat is a place for standing.' Then he departed when the sun had set and took Usamah bin Zaid as a companion rider, and he was motioning with his hand as was his custom, and the people were striking (their camels) on the right and the left to try and catch them, so he said: 'O you people! Be calmm.' Then he came to Jama and performed the two Salat there combined. When the morning came, he went to Quzah and stood there and said: 'This is Quzah, and it is a place of standing, and all of Jama is a place for standing.' Then he departed until he arrived at Wadi Muhassir. Then he stuck his she-camel and she trotted until he passed the valley. Then he stopped and took Al-Fadl as a companion rider and went to the Jamrah to stone it. Then he went to Al-Manhar and said: 'This is Al-Manhar, and all of Mina is a place for sacrifice.' A young girl from Khath'am came to ask him for a verdict, she said: 'Indeed my father is an elderly man who has lived until Allah has made Hajj obligatory, so would he be rewarded if I perform Hajj for him? He said: 'Perform Hajj for your father.'" He said: "And he turned the neck of Al Fadl. So Al-Abbas said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Why did you turn the neck of your cousin?' He said: 'I saw a young man and a young woman, and they were not safe from Shaitan.' A man came to him and said, 'O Messenger of Allah! I performed (Tawaf) Al-Ifadah before shaving.' He said: 'Shave, and there is no harm'" - or: 'Clip and there is no harm'" He said: "Someone else came and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I did the sacrifice before stoning.' So he said: 'Stone, and there is no harm.'" He said: "Then he went to the House (Ka'bah) to perform Tawaf around it, then he went to Zamzam and said: 'O tribe of Abdul-Muttalib! If it were not that the people would rush upon you then I would remove it.'"
